intro: Exacum tetragonum var. khasianum, commonly known as the Khasi bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped flowers that come in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a compact, bushy habit. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical, with a smooth surface and a slightly hairy texture. It is valued both for its ornamental appeal and its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
